cot.content:
To solve the problem, Please think and reason step by step, then answer.
question:
where will the next summer and winter olympics be held
        
Generation Format:
Reasoning process:
Answer:

Reasoning process:
To determine where the next Summer and Winter Olympics will be held, I need to identify the most recent Olympic Games and the upcoming ones. The Summer Olympics occur every four years, and the same is true for the Winter Olympics, but they are staggered so that there is an Olympic event every two years.

As of my last knowledge update in October 2023:
- The most recent Summer Olympics were held in Tokyo, Japan, in 2021 (originally scheduled for 2020 but postponed due to the COVID-19 pandemic).
- The next Summer Olympics are scheduled to take place in Paris, France, in 2024.
- The most recent Winter Olympics were held in Beijing, China, in 2022.
- The next Winter Olympics are scheduled to take place in Milan and Cortina d'Ampezzo, Italy, in 2026.

Now, I will summarize the locations for clarity.

Answer:
The next Summer Olympics will be held in Paris, France, in 2024, and the next Winter Olympics will be held in Milan and Cortina d'Ampezzo, Italy, in 2026.

anchoring.content:
You are a cognitive scientist, to answer the following question:
where will the next summer and winter olympics be held
I will provide you with several retrieved passages:
Passages:
['Biathlon at the 2018 Winter Olympics was held at the Alpensia Biathlon Centre, Daegwallyeong-myeon, Pyeongchang-gun, Gangwon-do, South Korea. There were eleven events contested: men and women competed in each of sprint, pursuit, individual, mass start, and relay; there was also a mixed relay event. The eleven events were scheduled to take place between 9 and 23 February 2018.\n', 'The 1952 Winter Olympics were held in and around Oslo, Norway, from 14 to 25 February 1952. Ten competition and eight non-competition venues were used, in addition to three designated, but unused, reserve competition venues. Six of the competition venues were located in Oslo, while one each was located in Bærum, Skedsmo, Drammen and Krødsherad. Bislett stadion was the centerpiece of the games, hosting the opening and closing ceremonies, the speed skating and the figure skating. Bislett featured both a circumference speed skating track and a long rink used for figure skating, separated by snow banks. Two reserve venues were designated for the skating events, Tryvann stadion in Oslo and Hamar stadion in Hamar.\n', "The 2026 Winter Olympics, officially known as the XXV Olympic Winter Games (; ), and commonly known as Milan-Cortina 2026, is a forthcoming international multi-sport event that is scheduled to take place from 6 to 22 February 2026 in the Italian cities of Milan and Cortina d'Ampezzo. Milan–Cortina d'Ampezzo beat another joint bid from Swedish cities Stockholm–Åre by 47–34 votes to be elected host cities at the 134th Session of the International Olympic Committee (IOC) in Lausanne, Switzerland, on 24 June 2019. \n", 'The 1988 Winter Paralympic Games (German: "Paralympische Winterspiele 1988") were the fourth Winter Paralympics, held again in Innsbruck, Austria. These were the last Winter Paralympics to be held in a separate location from the Winter Olympics. Beginning in 1992, the Olympics and the Paralympics were held in the same city or in an adjacent city. These Paralympics were not held at the same Olympic venue in Calgary, Canada, because of financial and recruiting difficulties. A total of 377 athletes from 22 countries took part. The USSR competed for the first and only time. Sit-skiing was introduced as another event in both the Alpine and Nordic skiing competitions. Other sports were biathlon and ice sledge speed racing. Ice sledge speed racer Knut Lundstroem from Norway was the most successful athlete, winning four gold medals in the 100m, 500m, 1000m and 1500m events.\n', 'The 2002 Winter Olympic Games were held in and around Salt Lake City, United States. The games ran from February 8 to 24, 2002, and the Paralympics from March 7 to 16, 2002. The sporting events were held in ten competitive venues, while non-competitive events, such as the opening ceremony, were held in six other venues. Three venues were also created for training purposes. All Olympic venues were scattered throughout Northern Utah.\n', "The host city for the 2022 Winter Olympics is Beijing, the capital of People's Republic of China, elected on 31 July 2015 at the 128th IOC Session in Kuala Lumpur. Beijing will be the first city ever to have hosted both the Summer and Winter Olympics. The 2022 Winter Olympics will take place between 4 and 20 February 2022. The 2026 Winter Olympics will be in Milan-Cortina d'Ampezzo, Italy and take place between 6 and 22 February 2026.\n", 'The 2016 Winter Youth Olympics (Norwegian: "Vinter-OL for ungdom 2016"), officially known as the II Winter Youth Olympic Games, took place in and around Lillehammer, Norway, between 12 February and 21 February 2016. They were the fourth Youth Olympic Games and the second winter edition. Lillehammer was awarded the games on 7 December 2011 as the only candidate. The games reused venues from the 1994 Winter Olympics. In addition to Lillehammer, sports were contested in Hamar, Gjøvik and Øyer.\n', 'Since the Paralympic Games began in 1960, there have been 15 Summer Paralympic Games held in 13 separate cities and 11 Winter Paralympic Games held in 10 separate cities. Four cities have been chosen by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) and the International Paralympic Committee (IPC) to host the upcoming Paralympics: Tokyo for the 2020 Summer Paralympics, Beijing for the 2022 Winter Paralympics, Paris for the 2024 Summer Paralympics, and Los Angeles for the 2028 Summer Paralympics.\n', 'The next World Winter Games will be held in Åre and Östersund, Sweden between February 2 to 13 2021. This will be the first time that Sweden has ever hosted the Special Olympics.\n', "BULLET::::- 2026 Winter Olympics will be held in Milan-Cortina d'Ampezzo, Italy.\n"]

Task Description:
Please extract content that may be unfamiliar to the model from these passages, 
which can provide the model with relevant background and unknown knowledge and concepts, 
helping it better understand the question. and analyze the role of these contents.

To address the question regarding the locations of the next Summer and Winter Olympics, we can extract and analyze relevant content from the provided passages. Here’s a breakdown of the pertinent information and its significance:

### Extracted Content

1. **2026 Winter Olympics**:
   - **Location**: Milan and Cortina d'Ampezzo, Italy.
   - **Dates**: Scheduled from February 6 to 22, 2026.
   - **Context**: This event is significant as it marks a return of the Winter Olympics to Italy, which previously hosted the Winter Games in 2006 in Turin. The selection process involved a competitive bidding, with Milan-Cortina winning against Stockholm-Åre.

2. **2024 Summer Olympics**:
   - **Location**: Paris, France.
   - **Context**: While not explicitly mentioned in the passages, the 2024 Summer Olympics are set to take place in Paris, which is a notable historical host city, having previously hosted the Olympics in 1900 and 1924.

3. **2022 Winter Olympics**:
   - **Location**: Beijing, China.
   - **Dates**: Held from February 4 to 20, 2022.
   - **Significance**: Beijing is notable for being the first city to host both the Summer (2008) and Winter Olympics, highlighting its growing prominence in international sports.

### Analysis of the Role of Extracted Content

- **Contextual Understanding**: The extracted information provides a timeline and geographical context for upcoming Olympic events, which is essential for understanding the global nature of the Olympics and the significance of host cities. Knowing that the Winter Olympics will be held in Milan-Cortina and the Summer Olympics in Paris allows for a clearer picture of the Olympic cycle and its international reach.

- **Historical Significance**: The mention of previous Olympic host cities (like Beijing and the historical context of Paris) enriches the understanding of the Olympics as a tradition that spans over a century. This historical perspective can help in appreciating the cultural and sporting legacy associated with these events.

- **Competitive Bidding Process**: The information about the competitive bidding process for the 2026 Winter Olympics illustrates the complexities involved in hosting such large-scale international events. This aspect can be unfamiliar to those who may not be aware of how host cities are selected, emphasizing the strategic importance of infrastructure, tourism, and international relations.

- **Cultural and Economic Impact**: By knowing the host cities, one can infer the potential cultural and economic impacts these events may have on the respective locations, including tourism boosts, infrastructure development, and international visibility.

### Conclusion

The extracted content serves to enhance the model's understanding of the upcoming Summer and Winter Olympics by providing essential details about their locations, historical context, and the competitive nature of the selection process. This background knowledge is crucial for answering questions related to the Olympics and for grasping the broader implications of these global sporting events.

Answer:

### Knowledge Enhanced Inference Process:

To determine where the next Summer and Winter Olympics will be held, I will analyze the most recent Olympic Games and the upcoming ones, considering the historical context and significance of these events.

1. **Olympic Schedule**: The Summer and Winter Olympics occur every four years, but they are staggered to ensure that there is an Olympic event every two years. This structure allows for continuous global engagement with the Olympic movement.

2. **Recent Olympic Events**:
   - The most recent Summer Olympics took place in Tokyo, Japan, in 2021. Originally scheduled for 2020, they were postponed due to the COVID-19 pandemic.
   - The most recent Winter Olympics were held in Beijing, China, in 2022.

3. **Upcoming Olympic Events**:
   - The next Summer Olympics are scheduled for **Paris, France**, from **July 26 to August 11, 2024**. This will be significant as it marks the third time Paris has hosted the Summer Olympics, having previously done so in 1900 and 1924. The return to Paris is expected to celebrate the city's rich Olympic history and cultural heritage.
   - The next Winter Olympics will take place in **Milan and Cortina d'Ampezzo, Italy**, from **February 6 to February 22, 2026**. This event is notable as it will be the first Winter Olympics hosted in Italy since the 2006 Winter Olympics in Turin, showcasing Italy's capability to host major international sporting events.

4. **Cultural and Economic Impact**: Hosting the Olympics often brings significant cultural and economic benefits to the host cities. For instance, the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris is expected to boost tourism and enhance the city's global profile. Similarly, the 2026 Winter Olympics in Milan-Cortina d'Ampezzo will likely promote winter sports and tourism in the region.

5. **Geopolitical Significance**: The selection of host cities reflects the International Olympic Committee's (IOC) strategy to promote geographical diversity and inclusivity. The successful bid of Milan-Cortina over other contenders, such as Stockholm-Åre, illustrates the competitive nature of the bidding process and the importance of showcasing different cultures and regions through the Olympics.

6. **Future Implications**: The choice of host cities can influence future bids and the overall landscape of the Olympic Games. The success of the upcoming events may encourage more cities to bid for future Olympics, thereby expanding the reach and impact of the Olympic movement globally.

### Conclusion:
By synthesizing this information, I can confidently state that the next Summer Olympics will be held in Paris, France, in 2024, and the next Winter Olympics will be held in Milan and Cortina d'Ampezzo, Italy, in 2026. This understanding not only answers the question but also provides a deeper appreciation of the Olympics' role in fostering international unity, cultural exchange, and global engagement.

### Answer:
The next Summer Olympics will be held in Paris, France, from July 26 to August 11, 2024, and the next Winter Olympics will be held in Milan and Cortina d'Ampezzo, Italy, from February 6 to February 22, 2026.

Beijing will be the first city ever to have hosted both the Summer and Winter Olympics. The 2022 Winter Olympics will take place between 4 and 20 February 2022. The 2026 Winter Olympics will be in Milan-Cortina d'Ampezzo, Italy and take place between 6 and 22 February 2026.
", 'The 2016 Winter Youth Olympics (Norwegian: "Vinter-OL for ungdom 2016"), officially known as the II Winter Youth Olympic Games, took place in and around Lillehammer, Norway, between 12 February and 21 February 2016. They were the fourth Youth Olympic Games and the second winter edition. Lillehammer was awarded the games on 7 December 2011 as the only candidate. The games reused venues from the 1994 Winter Olympics. In addition to Lillehammer, sports were contested in Hamar, Gjøvik and Øyer.
', 'Since the Paralympic Games began in 1960, there have been 15 Summer Paralympic Games held in 13 separate cities and 11 Winter Paralympic Games held in 10 separate cities. Four cities have been chosen by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) and the International Paralympic Committee (IPC) to host the upcoming Paralympics: Tokyo for the 2020 Summer Paralympics, Beijing for the 2022 Winter Paralympics, Paris for the 2024 Summer Paralympics, and Los Angeles for the 2028 Summer Paralympics.
', 'The next World Winter Games will be held in Åre and Östersund, Sweden between February 2 to 13 2021. This will be the first time that Sweden has ever hosted the Special Olympics.
', "BULLET::::- 2026 Winter Olympics will be held in Milan-Cortina d'Ampezzo, Italy.
"]

Task Description:
Please extract content from these passages that can help enhance the model's causal reasoning and logical inference abilities.
consolidate these contents, and analyze how the selected information may impact the improvement of the model's causal reasoning and logical inference capabilities.

To enhance the model's causal reasoning and logical inference abilities, we can extract and consolidate relevant information from the provided passages regarding the upcoming Summer and Winter Olympics. Here’s the extracted information:

### Extracted Information:

1. **Upcoming Events**:
   - The **2026 Winter Olympics** will be held in **Milan and Cortina d'Ampezzo, Italy**, from **February 6 to 22, 2026**.
   - The **2024 Summer Olympics** will be held in **Paris, France** (not explicitly mentioned in the passages but inferred from the context of upcoming events).
   - The **2028 Summer Olympics** will be held in **Los Angeles, United States** (also inferred from the context).

2. **Historical Context**:
   - The **2022 Winter Olympics** were held in **Beijing, China**, marking the first time a city hosted both Summer and Winter Olympics.
   - Previous Winter Olympics locations include **Pyeongchang, South Korea** (2018), **Salt Lake City, USA** (2002), and **Oslo, Norway** (1952).

3. **Decision Process**:
   - The selection of host cities involves a voting process by the International Olympic Committee (IOC), as seen in the election of Milan-Cortina over Stockholm-Åre for the 2026 Winter Olympics.

### Analysis of Impact on Causal Reasoning and Logical Inference:

1. **Temporal Reasoning**:
   - Understanding the sequence of events (e.g., the timeline of past and future Olympics) helps the model reason about the implications of hosting decisions and their historical significance. For instance, knowing that Beijing hosted both Olympics can lead to inferences about the city's capabilities and international standing.

2. **Geographical Context**:
   - The model can learn to associate specific cities with their respective Olympic events, enhancing its ability to infer geographical relationships and the significance of location in hosting large-scale international events.

3. **Decision-Making Processes**:
   - The information about the voting process for selecting host cities can improve the model's understanding of organizational decision-making. It can infer that certain cities may have advantages based on their proposals, infrastructure, and past experiences.

4. **Event Characteristics**:
   - By recognizing the different types of events (Summer vs. Winter Olympics), the model can better categorize and differentiate between various sports and their associated venues, leading to more nuanced reasoning about sports events.

5. **Future Predictions**:
   - The model can utilize the extracted information to make predictions about future trends in Olympic hosting, such as potential candidates for future games based on historical data and current geopolitical contexts.

### Conclusion:

The extracted content provides a rich foundation for enhancing the model's causal reasoning and logical inference capabilities. By understanding the relationships between events, locations, decision-making processes, and historical contexts, the model can develop a more sophisticated understanding of the implications surrounding the Olympics and similar large-scale events. This will ultimately improve its ability to reason about complex scenarios and make informed predictions.

question:
where will the next summer and winter olympics be held
answer:
Reasoning process:
To determine where the next Summer and Winter Olympics will be held, I need to identify the most recent Olympic Games and the upcoming ones. The Summer Olympics occur every four years, and the same is true for the Winter Olympics, but they are staggered so that there is an Olympic event every two years.

As of my last knowledge update in October 2023:
- The most recent Summer Olympics were held in Tokyo, Japan, in 2021 (originally scheduled for 2020 but postponed due to the COVID-19 pandemic).
- The next Summer Olympics are scheduled to take place in Paris, France, in 2024.
- The most recent Winter Olympics were held in Beijing, China, in 2022.
- The next Winter Olympics are scheduled to take place in Milan and Cortina d'Ampezzo, Italy, in 2026.

Now, I will summarize the locations for clarity.

Answer:
The next Summer Olympics will be held in Paris, France, in 2024, and the next Winter Olympics will be held in Milan and Cortina d'Ampezzo, Italy, in 2026.

### Knowledge Enhanced Inference Process:

To determine where the next Summer and Winter Olympics will be held, I will analyze the timeline of past and upcoming Olympic events, considering the established schedule of the Olympics and the locations of previous games.

1. **Understanding the Olympic Schedule**:
   - The Summer and Winter Olympics occur every four years, but they are staggered so that there is an Olympic event every two years. This means that after the Summer Olympics, the next event will be the Winter Olympics, and vice versa.

2. **Recent Olympic Events**:
   - The most recent Summer Olympics were held in **Tokyo, Japan**, in **2021** (originally scheduled for 2020 but postponed due to the COVID-19 pandemic).
   - The most recent Winter Olympics were held in **Beijing, China**, in **2022**.

3. **Upcoming Olympic Events**:
   - The next Summer Olympics are scheduled to take place in **Paris, France**, in **2024**.
   - The next Winter Olympics are scheduled to take place in **Milan and Cortina d'Ampezzo, Italy**, from **February 6 to 22, 2026**.

4. **Historical Context and Decision-Making**:
   - The selection of host cities involves a voting process by the International Olympic Committee (IOC). For instance, Milan-Cortina was chosen over Stockholm-Åre for the 2026 Winter Olympics, indicating a competitive selection process based on various factors, including infrastructure and previous hosting experience.

5. **Geographical and Temporal Relationships**:
   - Understanding the geographical context helps in associating specific cities with their respective Olympic events. For example, knowing that Beijing hosted both Summer and Winter Olympics can lead to inferences about its capabilities and international standing.

6. **Future Predictions**:
   - By analyzing the trends in Olympic hosting, such as the increasing emphasis on sustainability and infrastructure, the model can make informed predictions about potential future candidates for hosting the Olympics.

### Conclusion:

### Answer:
The next Summer Olympics will be held in **Paris, France**, in **2024**, and the next Winter Olympics will be held in **Milan and Cortina d'Ampezzo, Italy**, from **February 6 to 22, 2026**.

Fact-checking refers to the process of confirming the accuracy of a statement or claim through various sources or methods. 
This process aims to ensure that statements or claims are based on reliable and verifiable information while eliminating inaccurate or misleading content. 
Fact-checking may involve the examination of data, literature, expert opinions, or other trustworthy sources.
In the context of artificial intelligence, model illusion refers to the overconfidence response of the AI. 
When a model exhibits an 'illusion' (a tendency to output deceptive data), it indicates that the training data used by the model does not necessarily support the rationality of its outputs.
You are a scientist researching fact-checking and addressing model illusions in artificial intelligence.

['Biathlon at the 2018 Winter Olympics was held at the Alpensia Biathlon Centre, Daegwallyeong-myeon, Pyeongchang-gun, Gangwon-do, South Korea. Ten competition and eight non-competition venues were used, in addition to three designated, but unused, reserve competition venues. Six of the competition venues were located in Oslo, while one each was located in Bærum, Skedsmo, Drammen and Krødsherad. Bislett stadion was the centerpiece of the games, hosting the opening and closing ceremonies, the speed skating and the figure skating. Bislett featured both a circumference speed skating track and a long rink used for figure skating, separated by snow banks. Two reserve venues were designated for the skating events, Tryvann stadion in Oslo and Hamar stadion in Hamar.\n', "The 2026 Winter Olympics, officially known as the XXV Olympic Winter Games (; ), and commonly known as Milan-Cortina 2026, is a forthcoming international multi-sport event that is scheduled to take place from 6 to 22 February 2026 in the Italian cities of Milan and Cortina d'Ampezzo. Milan–Cortina d'Ampezzo beat another joint bid from Swedish cities Stockholm–Åre by 47–34 votes to be elected host cities at the 134th Session of the International Olympic Committee (IOC) in Lausanne, Switzerland, on 24 June 2019. \n", 'The 1988 Winter Paralympic Games (German: "Paralympische Winterspiele 1988") were the fourth Winter Paralympics, held again in Innsbruck, Austria. These were the last Winter Paralympics to be held in a separate location from the Winter Olympics. Beginning in 1992, the Olympics and the Paralympics were held in the same city or in an adjacent city. These Paralympics were not held at the same Olympic venue in Calgary, Canada, because of financial and recruiting difficulties. A total of 377 athletes from 22 countries took part. The USSR competed for the first and only time. Sit-skiing was introduced as another event in both the Alpine and Nordic skiing competitions. Other sports were biathlon and ice sledge speed racing. Ice sledge speed racer Knut Lundstroem from Norway was the most successful athlete, winning four gold medals in the 100m, 500m, 1000m and 1500m events.\n', 'The 2002 Winter Olympic Games were held in and around Salt Lake City, United States. The games ran from February 8 to 24, 2002, and the Paralympics from March 7 to 16, 2002. The sporting events were held in ten competitive venues, while non-competitive events, such as the opening ceremony, were held in six other venues. Three venues were also created for training purposes. All Olympic venues were scattered throughout Northern Utah.\n', "The host city for the 2022 Winter Olympics is Beijing, the capital of People's Republic of China, elected on 31 July 2015 at the 128th IOC Session in Kuala Lumpur. Beijing will be the first city ever to have hosted both the Summer and Winter Olympics. The 2022 Winter Olympics will take place between 4 and 20 February 2022. The 2026 Winter Olympics will be in Milan-Cortina d'Ampezzo, Italy and take place between 6 and 22 February 2026.\n", 'The 2016 Winter Youth Olympics (Norwegian: "Vinter-OL for ungdom 2016"), officially known as the II Winter Youth Olympic Games, took place in and around Lillehammer, Norway, between 12 February and 21 February 2016. They were the fourth Youth Olympic Games and the second winter edition. Lillehammer was awarded the games on 7 December 2011 as the only candidate. The games reused venues from the 1994 Winter Olympics. In addition to Lillehammer, sports were contested in Hamar, Gjøvik and Øyer.\n', 'Since the Paralympic Games began in 1960, there have been 15 Summer Paralympic Games held in 13 separate cities and 11 Winter Paralympic Games held in 10 separate cities. Four cities have been chosen by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) and the International Paralympic Committee (IPC) to host the upcoming Paralympics: Tokyo for the 2020 Summer Paralympics, Beijing for the 2022 Winter Paralympics, Paris for the 2024 Summer Paralympics, and Los Angeles for the 2028 Summer Paralympics.\n', 'The next World Winter Games will be held in Åre and Östersund, Sweden between February 2 to 13 2021. question_info.question: where will the next summer and winter olympics be held
passages:
Biathlon at the 2018 Winter Olympics was held at the Alpensia Biathlon Centre, Daegwallyeong-myeon, Pyeongchang-gun, Gangwon-do, South Korea. There were eleven events contested: men and women competed in each of sprint, pursuit, individual, mass start, and relay; there was also a mixed relay event. The eleven events were scheduled to take place between 9 and 23 February 2018.
The 1952 Winter Olympics were held in and around Oslo, Norway, from 14 to 25 February 1952. Ten competition and eight non-competition venues were used, in addition to three designated, but unused, reserve competition venues. Six of the competition venues were located in Oslo, while one each was located in Bærum, Skedsmo, Drammen and Krødsherad. Bislett stadion was the centerpiece of the games, hosting the opening and closing ceremonies, the speed skating and the figure skating. Bislett featured both a circumference speed skating track and a long rink used for figure skating, separated by snow banks. Two reserve venues were designated for the skating events, Tryvann stadion in Oslo and Hamar stadion in Hamar.
The 2026 Winter Olympics, officially known as the XXV Olympic Winter Games (; ), and commonly known as Milan-Cortina 2026, is a forthcoming international multi-sport event that is scheduled to take place from 6 to 22 February 2026 in the Italian cities of Milan and Cortina d'Ampezzo. Milan–Cortina d'Ampezzo beat another joint bid from Swedish cities Stockholm–Åre by 47–34 votes to be elected host cities at the 134th Session of the International Olympic Committee (IOC) in Lausanne, Switzerland, on 24 June 2019. 
The 1988 Winter Paralympic Games (German: "Paralympische Winterspiele 1988") were the fourth Winter Paralympics, held again in Innsbruck, Austria. These were the last Winter Paralympics to be held in a separate location from the Winter Olympics. Beginning in 1992, the Olympics and the Paralympics were held in the same city or in an adjacent city. These Paralympics were not held at the same Olympic venue in Calgary, Canada, because of financial and recruiting difficulties. A total of 377 athletes from 22 countries took part. The USSR competed for the first and only time. Sit-skiing was introduced as another event in both the Alpine and Nordic skiing competitions. Other sports were biathlon and ice sledge speed racing. Ice sledge speed racer Knut Lundstroem from Norway was the most successful athlete, winning four gold medals in the 100m, 500m, 1000m and 1500m events.
The 2002 Winter Olympic Games were held in and around Salt Lake City, United States. The games ran from February 8 to 24, 2002, and the Paralympics from March 7 to 16, 2002. The sporting events were held in ten competitive venues, while non-competitive events, such as the opening ceremony, were held in six other venues. Three venues were also created for training purposes. All Olympic venues were scattered throughout Northern Utah.
The host city for the 2022 Winter Olympics is Beijing, the capital of People's Republic of China, elected on 31 July 2015 at the 128th IOC Session in Kuala Lumpur. Beijing will be the first city ever to have hosted both the Summer and Winter Olympics. The 2022 Winter Olympics will take place between 4 and 20 February 2022. The 2026 Winter Olympics will be in Milan-Cortina d'Ampezzo, Italy and take place between 6 and 22 February 2026.
The 2016 Winter Youth Olympics (Norwegian: "Vinter-OL for ungdom 2016"), officially known as the II Winter Youth Olympic Games, took place in and around Lillehammer, Norway, between 12 February and 21 February 2016. They were the fourth Youth Olympic Games and the second winter edition. Lillehammer was awarded the games on 7 December 2011 as the only candidate. The games reused venues from the 1994 Winter Olympics. In addition to Lillehammer, sports were contested in Hamar, Gjøvik and Øyer.
Since the Paralympic Games began in 1960, there have been 15 Summer Paralympic Games held in 13 separate cities and 11 Winter Paralympic Games held in 10 separate cities. Four cities have been chosen by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) and the International Paralympic Committee (IPC) to host the upcoming Paralympics: Tokyo for the 2020 Summer Paralympics, Beijing for the 2022 Winter Paralympics, Paris for the 2024 Summer Paralympics, and Los Angeles for the 2028 Summer Paralympics.
The next World Winter Games will be held in Åre and Östersund, Sweden between February 2 to 13 2021. This will be the first time that Sweden has ever hosted the Special Olympics.
BULLET::::- 2026 Winter Olympics will be held in Milan-Cortina d'Ampezzo, Italy.
__answers__: Tokyo for the 2020 Summer Olympics , Beijing for the 2022 Winter Olympics
